the Museum of Paleontology a Helio

Fidelio is named after an Italian born
geologist who spent most of his career

in Argentina and conducted extensive
geologic studies across Patagonia the

museum begins with a gallery that
focuses on the first human settlements

in the area about ten thousand years ago
and then it transports you back to the

Mesozoic era when dinosaurs roamed these
lands there are over 30 dinosaurs on

display and you can even see some
dinosaur eggs so if you're a Dino

lots of tourists make the trip out here
